clinical_study.brief_title: New Tools for the Diagnosis, Prognosis and Treatment Follow-up in Chagas Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evolution of Serologic Biomarkers and Diastolic Function and Segmentary Contractility Determined by Echocardiography After Treatment in Chagas Diseases

lead_sponsor.agency: Barcelona Centre for International Health Research

clinical_study.source: Barcelona Centre for International Health Research

brief_summary.textblock: Chagas disease is endemic to Latin America, and is of emerging importance in non-endemic countries because migration of people infected with T. cruzi. Current methods for diagnosis of T. cruzi infection are not ideal. Existing drugs for treatment are very limited, produce severe side-effects, and their effectiveness cannot be properly evaluated. Reliable biomarkers for prognosis, early diagnosis and effectiveness of treatment will be investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers for prognosis, early diagnosis and effectiveness of treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Conventional polymerase chain reaction of T. cruzi in blood Measurement of Brain natriuretic factor Measurement of Prothrombotic factors Measurement of antibodies against specific proteins of the trypomastigote of T. cruzi Investigation of the phylogenetics of the parasite and the role of the lineages of T.cruzi in the clinical presentation and disease's progression

secondary_outcome.description: - Correlation between biomarkers and alterations of the left ventricle diastolic function and segmentary contractility after antiparasitic treatment

arm_group.description: Participants with no Chagas Disease will be evaluated as a Control Group
Participants diagnosed with Chagas Disease will be followed-up as a Case Group

study_pop.textblock: Migrants from Latin America visiting the Tropical Medicin Clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients from endemic areas (Latin America)
- Older than 18 years old and younger than 50
- With serological confirmation of Chagas Disease infection with two different techniques
- Indeterminate or initial cardiac form
- No previously treated for Chagas Disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Co-morbidity: previous cardiac disease from other aetiology (ischemic, alcoholic or hypertensive), active inflammatory or immunology diseases for another agent. Hepatic disfunction
- Pregnancy or lactation
